description.hltext_display: Sounds like a broken record: UConn women's basketball team wins 89th straight game, topping UCLA men's mark
description.author: Doug Feinberg
description.content:
UConn women's basketball coach Geno Auriemma, never at a loss for words, was close Tuesday night.
"It's pretty amazing. It really is," he said.
No exaggeration there.
His No. 1-ranked Huskies topped the 88-game winning streak set by John Wooden's UCLA men's team from 1971-74, beating No. 22 Florida State 93-62. Playing with the relentlessness that has become its trademark - and would have made Wooden proud - UConn blew past the Seminoles as it has so many other teams in the last 2½ years.
"I don't want my team to compare themselves to anyone," Auriemma said. "I'm not John Wooden and this isn't UCLA. This is Connecticut and that's good enough."
Maya Moore had a career-high 41 points and 10 rebounds and freshman Bria Hartley added 21 points for the Huskies, who have not lost since April 6, 2008, in the NCAA tournament semifinals. Only twice during the record run has a team come within single digits of UConn - Stanford in the NCAA championship game last season and Baylor in early November.
When the final buzzer sounded, UConn players sprinted across the floor to shake hands with the student section as fans held up "89" signs and "89" balloons bobbed in the stands behind center court. Two other fans raised a banner that read "The Sorcerer of Storrs" - a play on Wooden's nickname, "The Wizard
of Westwood."
After a brief huddle in front of their bench, UConn players re-emerged wearing "89 and Counting" T-shirts. As fans roared, the players bounced around at center court before posing for photos.
It is one more chapter of history for UConn, and perhaps the grandest.
Asked what he would recall from the incredible run, Auriemma mentioned a pair of experienced stars on this team: "I'll probably remember Maya Moore and Tiffany Hayes. And how incredibly difficult it is to play that many games in a row and win 'em all."
Connecticut long ago established itself as the marquee program in the women's game, the benchmark by which all others are measured. The Huskies already own seven national titles and four perfect seasons under Auriemma, and they've produced a galaxy of stars that includes Rebecca Lobo, Diana Taurasi, Jennifer Rizzotti, Sue Bird and Tina Charles.
The streak, though, takes it to another level, certainly raising the profile of women's basketball and maybe all of women's athletics.
Two days after beating No. 11 Ohio State to tie UCLA, UConn toppled the mark in front of a sellout crowd of 16,294 at the XL Center that included Wooden's grandson, Greg, attending his first women's game.
"My grandfather would have been thrilled. He would have been absolutely thrilled to see his streak broken by a women's basketball team," the 47-year-old Wooden said. "He thought, especially in the last 10 years, that the best basketball was played at the collegiate level - and it wasn't by the men."
John Wooden was 99 when he died on June 4.
There was a festive atmosphere throughout the city, where building lights gleamed blue and white, and it was as electric as any Final Four inside the arena. Charles and UConn men's star Kemba Walker sat behind the Huskies' bench, and football coach Randy Edsall was there, too. Former NFL star Warrick Dunn, meanwhile, was cheering for his alma mater, Florida State.
With the game tied at 6, Moore and UConn (11-0) took command. The senior All-American had seven points during a 15-2 run to give Connecticut its first double-digit lead, and Moore's fadeaway jumper from the baseline extended the advantage to 34-15. Florida State (9-3) made a quick run to cut the lead to 11, but the Huskies weren't about to let anyone spoil this night.
UConn ripped off the next 16 points, capped by consecutive 3-pointers from Hartley and a pull-up by Moore. Auriemma gave Hartley a kiss at the next timeout, and the tough-to-please coach was still grinning at halftime.
"She doesn't feel any of this," Auriemma said as he left the court. "She's kind of immune to all of this as a freshman. I love kids like that."
With a minute left to play and victory assured, Moore stood up and whirled a towel around her head. The All-American tossed it in the air briefly before sitting down for the final seconds, beaming as she and her teammates on the bench yelled encouragement at the players on the floor.
"All you guys from Florida State, it wasn't easy to be part of all of this," Auriemma said. "I hope you don't feel disrespected by all this. You played a heck of a game."
During his postgame news conference, Auriemma took a congratulatory phone call from President Barack Obama.
"Mr. President I really appreciate that. It's an incredible thing that these kids have done and we owe you a little bit of gratitude. That lesson you gave on the White House basketball court really paid off. I appreciate you doing that for them," Auriemma said.
"We have not lost since you have been inaugurated and how 'bout we keep that streak going for a couple of more years, huh?"
UConn's rise to prominence began in 1995, when Lobo led the Huskies to their first national championship and unbeaten season. Since then, the best players in the country have made their way to the rural campus in Storrs, 30 miles outside of Hartford.
"This streak is result of the program Geno has been building at UConn for a long time.
Great players want to play for him," Taurasi said in an e-mail to The Associated Press.
"What UConn has done is important and significant on its own merit. All this talk about comparison to Wooden's UCLA men is just silly. It's not about women vs. men, it's about basketball. Both teams beat their respective competition night in and night out."
The excellence and confidence that defines great teams defines this one because Auriemma won't have it any other way. Perfection is expected, not simply a goal, and Auriemma goes to extraordinary lengths to get it.
He goads his players with criticisms of their games - sarcastic remarks that may strike outsiders as harsh but somehow trigger just the right response with gusto. He makes them play games of seven-on-five in practice. He rounds up bigger, stronger male students around campus to serve as practice players. He runs endless drills to hone skills the players thought they had mastered in junior high.
It hardly seems to matter who is on the floor because UConn players don't wear names on the back of their uniforms. The only one that counts is the one on the front.
When UConn - led by Taurasi - won 70 straight games from 2001-03, a record in the women's game, it seemed unfathomable that it would be toppled, like UCLA's 88. But what fans have learned over the years is that nothing this team does should be surprising.
"I didn't think that it would be possible," Florida State coach Sue Semrau said. "It's still impossible to me that it's happened. But I've watched Geno grow his program and the job that he's done and I'm not surprised its Connecticut."
The Huskies have beaten 16 top-10 teams during the latest streak - four more than UCLA did during its run - and five of those wins came against the No. 2 team. It's been more than 17 years since UConn lost consecutive games.
The Huskies have won by any average of more than 33 points during the streak and rarely found themselves in trouble. They have trailed for 134 minutes, including only 13 in the second half. They've won back-to-back national championships, and are now one short of Tennessee's record for overall titles by a women's team.
"It's really something special to watch," Bird said by phone from her home in Seattle.
"Both UCLA and UConn's streaks have been something special. Neither team ever took a night off."
Even before UConn tied UCLA's record, the two programs were linked.
Auriemma acknowledges that his team runs the same offense that Wooden perfected 37 years earlier. But it's not just the Xs and Os. The top block of Wooden's pyramid of success reads: "Competitive Greatness: Perform at your best when your best is required. Your best is required every day."
That's been Auriemma's mantra all along.
Greg Wooden, who lives in California, said he came East because, "I kind of thought that somebody should come here from the family and show support."
He also was aware that "certain players have said they're not really supportive of the streak."
But he came knowing "my grandfather would have loved to have been here to see this."
The day Notre Dame broke UCLA's streak, John Wooden was asked how long it would be before somebody surpassed it.
"I have no idea how long it will be before somebody else wins that many. I know it takes at least three years," he replied.
Try 36 years, 11 months, and 2 days.

description.hltext_display: Carl Clayton Coulston
description.content:
t his home in Seymour. Funeral services are scheduled for 10 A.M. Thursday, December 23, 2010 at the Vera United Methodist Church in Vera, Texas, with Carl Fisher, pastor of the First Christian Church officiating. Interment will be in the Vera Cemetery under the direction of Seymour Memorial Funeral Home.
Carl was born to George Adam and Alma Coulston on October 14, 1918 in Orange, Texas. He married the love of his life, Thelma Hughes
in 1938. They were wed for 69 1/2 years. Carl was a lifelong farmer in the Vera Community, a veteran of World War II, and a 50 year plus
member of the Masonic Lodge.
He is survived by three children, Benny and Diane Coulston of Austin, Texas, Jim and Nelda Coulston of Nocona, Texas, and
Vicki and Jim Berrier of Lubbock, Texas; 9 grandchildren and 16 great-grandchildren.
He was preceded in death by his wife, Thelma; his parents; three sisters, Vernie Keith, Ida Haney and Evelyn Dunnivant; and five
step-brothers and sisters.
Visitation will be at the Seymour Memorial Funeral Home , Wednesday evening from 6-7 P.M.
Memorials may be made to the Vera Cemetery or to the Vera Community Center.

description.hltext_display: - İtalya Metrosunda Bomba Paniği
description.content: - İtalya METROSUNDA BOMBA PANİĞİ İtalyan polisi bugün yapılması beklenen öğrenci gösterileri için alarma geçirilirken, başkent Roma'daki metronun, Rebibbia durağında boş bir trende el yapısı bomba bulunduğunu açıklandı. İtalyan güvenlik birimleri patlayıcı toz miktarının az olan, fünyesi takılı olmadığı için patlama bulunmayan bombanın korku amaçlı konulduğunu bildirdi. Hükumetin kemer sıkma önlemlerine karşı geçen hafta düzenlenen öğrenci gösterilerinde ciddi olaylar çıkan İtalya'daki metro vagonunda bulunan el yapımı bir bomba, güvenlik ekipleri tarafından etkisiz hale getirildi. Metronun B hattında duran bir vagonda kondüktör tarafından fark edilen bir alışveriş poşetinin içinden el yapımı bir bomba bulundu. Bomba düzeneği güvenlik birimleri tarafından incelendiği belirtildi. Düzeneğin metronun B hattının son duraklarından biri olan Rebibbia'da park halindeki vagonda bulunması sayesinde ulaşımda aksaklık olmadı. Roma Büyükşehir Belediye Başkanı Gianni Alemanno, olayı kaygı verici olarak değerlendirdi. (Doğan Haber Ajansı) 24 dakika önce.. [2430083]

description.hltext_display: Recomiendan a Silvia Pinal reposo debido a problema en la pierna
Frappes aériennes israéliennes; tirs dobus palestiniens
description.content:
Frappes aériennes israéliennes; tirs d’obus palestiniens
Le Temps-Agences - Une nouvelle roquette tirée à partir de la bande de Gaza a touché hier matin un kibboutz dans le sud d'Israël, faisant un blessé léger, après des frappes aériennes israéliennes et des tirs d'obus de groupes armés palestiniens, a annoncé l'armée israélienne.
L'engin est tombé en début de matinée près d'un jardin d'enfants du kibboutz Zikkim, au sud de la ville d'Ashkelon, à environ deux kilomètres de la bande de Gaza.
Une jeune femme a été légèrement blessée par un éclat d'obus, a annoncé la police. Selon les médias israéliens, il s'agit d'une adolescente de 14 ans qui se rendait à l'école.

description.hltext_display: Aandelenkoersen stijgen vooral in eerste halfjaar
description.content:
Sell in July and come back in October
Aandelenkoersen stijgen vooral in de eerste helft van het jaar, namelijk ruim 7% tegen 1,5% in het tweede halfjaar.
Dividend
Hierbij moet nog worden bedacht dat in de eerste helft van het jaar meer dividend wordt uitgekeerd dan in de tweede helft. Dat blijkt uit cijfers van het CBS over de peridoe 1953-2009. Januari is de beste maand voor beleggers. De gemiddelde koersstijging over 57 januarimaanden bedroeg 2,2%. September komt als slechtste beleggingsmaand uit de bus met een gemiddelde krimp van 2,2%.
'Sell in July and come back in October'
Een oude beurswijsheid zegt: Sell in May and go away, but remember: come back in September. Uit de analyses blijkt dat de stelling enige aanpassing behoeft. Eind juli is de beste maand om te verkopen om pas begin oktober weer in de markt te stappen. De belegger die het zo had gedaan, had gemiddeld ruim 2%meer koerswinst gemaakt.

description.hltext_display: Pedro ‘Pete’ Rodriguez
description.content:
in Wichita Falls.
The funeral service will be conducted at 10:00 a.m. Thursday, December 23, 2010, in the chapel of Owens & Brumley Funeral Home of Wichita Falls. Interment with military honors will follow at 2:00 p.m. at Ft. Sill National Cemetery. Arrangements are under the direction of Owens & Brumley Funeral Home of Wichita Falls. The son of the late Pablo and Estefana Rodriguez, he was born December 10, 1947, in Wichita Falls.
Pedro was employed by North American Pipes for many years as a production worker.
Survivors include his wife; Andrea Rodriguez of Wichita Falls, two daughters; Andrea Whited and husband, Shawn, and Maria Munos and husband, Lionel, all of Wichita Falls; three sons; Simon Rodriguez and Eli Rodriguez both of Wichita Falls, and Sgt. Rodriquez Guillermo and wife, Christina, of Killeen, three sisters; Irene Contreras, Ramona Enriquez and Olivia Escalante of Wichita Falls, one brother; Benito Rodriguez of Wichita Falls, 12 grandchildren.
The family will receive friends and family from 7:00 until 8:00 p.m., Wednesday, December 22, 2010, at Owens & Brumley Funeral Home of Wichita Falls.
Condolences may be sent to the family at www.owensandbrumley.com.

entity.property: Brumley Funeral Home of Wichita Falls

description.hltext_display: Kondisi Kapten Timnas Indonesia Membaik
description.content:
Rabu, 22 Desember 2010 14:34 WIB 0 Komentar 0 0
JAKARTA--MICOM: Kondisi kesehatan kapten Timnas Indonesia Firman Utina mulai membaik pascacedera yang dialami pada pertandingan semifinal pertama Piala AFF 2010 melawan Filipina.
Pemain yang saat ini memperkuat klub Sriwijaya FC mengalami cidera lutut yang cukup parah. Namun pada pertandingan semifinal kedua melawan Filipina tetap diturunkan pelatih meski harus mendapatkan suntikan pengurang rasa sakit.
"Firman sudah bisa gabung latihan dengan pemain yang lain besok, Kamis (23/12)," kata pelatih timnas Alfred Riedl usai latihan timnas di Lapangan PSSI, Jakarta, Rabu (22/12).
Menurut dia, dengan membaiknya Firman Utina maka untuk posisi pemain tengah telah komplet seperti pada pertandingan-pertandingan sebelumnya. Meski demikian, pihaknya akan terus memantau perkembangan pemain kelahiran Manado itu.
Firman Utina pada sesi latihan pagi, hanya melakukan latihan ringan bersama fisioterapis timnas Mathias Ibo. Terlihat lutut kanan mantan pemain Arema Malang itu masih dibalut dengan kinesio tape atau penarik otot.
Ditanya kondisi gelandang lincah Oktovianus Maniani, pelatih asal Austria itu belum memberikan jawaban yang pasti. Pemain asal Papua itu masih diragukan untuk bergabung dengan pemain yang lain.
"Okto masih belum bisa gabung. Tetapi saya berharap Okto bisa tampil pada partai final nanti," kata mantan pelatih timnas Laos itu.
Teman satu tim Firman Utina di klub Sriwijaya FC mengalami cidera hamstring pada pertandingan semifinal melawan Filipina. Saat ini proses penyembuhan masih berlangsung dibawah arahan fisioterapis timnas, Mathias Ibo. (Ant/rj/OL-5)

description.hltext_display: Mantendrá Obama lucha por Dream Act
description.author: NTX/EFE/AP
description.content:
Insiste Presidente de EU que la reforma migratoria debe ser prioritaria
El sábado, el Senado de Estados Unidos rechazó aprobar la iniciativa Dream Act, que habría legalizado a 800 mil estudiantes indocumentados.
Fotografía: AP.
WASHINGTON (NTX/EFE/AP)._ El Presidente Barack Obama externó ayer su "profunda decepción" por el fracaso en el Senado de la ley Dream Act, pero sostuvo que mantendrá los esfuerzos para su aprobación porque la reforma migratoria debe ser prioritaria.
Durante una reunión en la Casa Blanca con un grupo legislativo hispano, Obama reiteró su compromiso con una reforma migratoria integral al señalar que no se puede perpetuar un sistema migratorio descompuesto que no funciona ni para el País ni para la economía.
Los legisladores presentes en el encuentro fueron el Senador Bob Menéndez y los congresistas Xavier Becerra, Nydia Velázquez, Luis Gutiérrez y Charlie González.
Gutiérrez señaló en un comunicado que Obama expresó su deseo de sostener otra reunión justo después del Año Nuevo para definir la nueva estrategia.
"Con los republicanos asumiendo la mayoría en la Cámara baja, cuyos líderes se oponen con fuerza a la inmigración y a la reforma migratoria, probablemente estaremos en buena parte a la defensiva en los próximos dos años. Obviamente, el poder de veto del Presidente es un arma crucial contra políticas radicalmente antiinmigrantes", agregó Gutiérrez.
"El Presidente y los miembros coincidieron que el pueblo estadounidense espera que ambos partidos (Demócrata y Republicano) se acerquen en torno a enfoques de sentido común para los problemas más difíciles… y acordó trabajar con el Congreso para completar el trabajo", señaló la Casa Blanca.
La ley Dream Act, que habría abierto las puertas a la legalización de unos 800 mil estudiantes indocumentados, no logró el sábado obtener los 60 votos necesarios para ser llevada a voto final en el Senado, luego de que ya había sido aprobada en la Cámara de Representantes.
Los demócratas Kay Hagan de Carolina del Norte, Max Baucus de Montana, Ben Nelson de Nebraska y Mark Pryor de Arkansas votaron en contra y sólo tres republicanos, Richard Lugar de Indiana, Bob Bennett de Utah y Lisa Murkowski de Alaska votaron a favor.
"El Presidente y los miembros expresaron su profunda decepción por el fracaso de la Ley Dream a pesar de que tenía el apoyo de una mayoría de senadores y de una mayoría del pueblo estadounidense", señaló la Casa Blanca.
"También coincidieron en que la reforma migratoria debe ser una alta prioridad para el próximo Congreso, a fin de trabajar juntos no sólo para fortalecer la seguridad en las fronteras del País, sino para restablecer la responsabilidad y rendición de cuentas", finalizó.
El rechazo del Senado al Dream Act ha supuesto un duro golpe a las esperanzas demócratas de poder sacar adelante esta medida, que habría beneficiado a cientos de miles de personas.
FUTURO PROFESIONAL
El Departamento de Educación calcula que cada año son más de 50 mil los jóvenes indocumentados que finalizan los estudios secundarios con posibilidad de acceder a la universidad.
"El Presidente y los miembros coincidieron que el pueblo estadounidense espera que ambos partidos (Demócrata y Republicano) se acerquen en torno a enfoques de sentido común para los problemas más difíciles...".
Comunicado de la Casa Blanca

description.content:

Aþaðýdaki kodu kopyalayýp videonun yayýnlanmasýný istediðiniz yere yapýþtýrýn.
Rusya'nýn resmi devlet televizyonu Rossiya, Voronej kenti yakýnlarýnda ormanda kurulan dazlaklarýn terör kampýný gezdi. Gözleri kapalý þekilde kampa getirilen Rus muhabir, gördüðü manzara karþýsýnda þok olurken, dazlaklar nasýl "düþmanlarýný" öldürdüðünü hiç endiþe duymadan uygulamalý olarak gösterdi. Rus uzmanlar, orta vadede etnik düþmanlýk gibi sorunlarýn çözülmemesi durumunda Rusya Federasyonu'nun týpký eski Sovyetler Birliði gibi daðýlacaðý uyarýsýnda bulundu.
Rossiya kanalýnýn her pazar günü akþam saatlerinde yayýnlanan, Mariya Sittel'in sunduðu "Spetsialnýy Korrespondet" isimli açýk oturum programýnda bu haftaki baþlýk "Nefretin Ýlkeleri" idi. Programda önce muhabir Aleksandr Rogatkin'in dazlak terör kampý ziyareti gösterildi. Ýnternet üzerinden haberleþerek ýrkçýlarla temasa geçen Rus muhabir, kendilerinden randevu alarak dazlak terör kampýný ziyaret etti. Gözleri baðlanarak kampa getirilen Rogatkin, dazlak teröristlerin nasýl savaþ eðitimi aldýðýný izledi. Þiþe dolu benzin atarak "hedefi" yakan, silah atan ve "düþmanýný" arkadan ve önden býçaklayan dazlaklar yaptýklarý faaliyetlerini överek anlattý.
Muhabir Rogatkin, "Burasý Rus Nasyonel Sosyalist örgütünün kampý. Gözlerimizi kapatarak getirdiler. Voronej yakýnlýðýndaki ormanlýk bir alan... Rusya'nýn çoðu yerinde böyle dazlak kampý var... Burada dazlaklar insan öldürmek için eðitim alýyorlar.. Onlar yýllardýr bu savaþa hazýrlanýyor. Ölüm ve terör tekniðini öðreniyorlar. Yaklaþýk 10 maskeli genç, yaþlarý ortalama 20" dedi.
Muhabire insan öldürmeyin "tekniðini" anlatan Uragan lakaplý bir dazlak, "Arkadan saldýrdýðýnda sýrtýndan ya da böbreklerinden býçaðý saplayacaksýn. ya da boðazýný keseceksin. Býçaðý soktuktan sonra döndürmek lazým" dedi. Uragan'ýn asýl ismi Artyom Krasnolutksi ve Voronej'in en prestijli yüksek eðitim kurumlarýnýn birinde okuyor, ayrýca çete lideri.
Dazlak lideri, "Bizim için nefret en önemli silah ve araç!" diye mücadelesini tanýtýyor. Muhabir botlarýndaki beyaz iplikleri göstererek "Beyaz iplikleri taþýmak insan öldürmek anlamýna geliyor. Ýnsan öldürdünüz mü?" sorusuna dazlak lideri Krasnolutski, "Kamera arkasýnda böyle þeyleri söylemek olmaz. Ama Nasyonel Sosyalistlerin niteliði, sýfatý öldürmektir. Eðer bunu yapmadýysan Nasyonel Sosyalist deðilsin" yanýtýný veriyor.
Rus muhabir hiç kimse tarafýndan finanse edilmediklerini iddia eden dazlaklarýn ellerinde çok pahalý tabancalarýn olduðuna da dikkat çekiyor. Muhabir gördüðü kamptan þok olduðunu saklamayarak, "Olup bitenlere bakýlýrsa onlara birisi bu eðitimi, silah atmasýný ve ateþle oynamasýný öðretmiþ" deðerlendirmesinde bulunuyor. Muhabir, "Bu ziyaretimizin ardýndan Krasnolutski göz altýna alýndý. Ülkede böyle kaç tane silahlý örgüt var kimse bilmiyor" dedi.
Rusya'da son dönemde Kafkas kökenli gruplarla ýrkçý dazlak gruplar arasýndaki çatýþmalar nedeni ile Rusya'da tansiyon hala yüksek. Ýki haftadýr polis 2 binden fazla göçmen ve dazlaðý göz altýna alýrken, Rus halký ýrkçý ve dazlak gruplarýn bu seviyede artmasýnýn nedenlerini tartýþýyor.
Rusya'nýn farklý kentlerinde de ýrkçý gruplarýn saldýrýsýna uðrayan eski Sovyet ülkelerinden onlarca göçmen hastaneye kaldýrýldý. Rusya insan haklarý örgütü Sova'nýn verilerine göre yýl baþýndan bu yana etnik nefrete dayalý çýkan 350'inin üzerinde olayda 36 kiþi yaþamýný yitirdi. (Cihan Haber Ajansý) 59 dakika önce.. [2429986]

description.hltext_display: Quand la Chine sénerve !
description.content:
:namespace prefix = o ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office" /
Par Malek Slim - Le prix Nobel de la paix décerné au dissident chinois Lui Xiaobo a été perçu comme un acte dagression par Pékin dénonçant une « conspiration planétaire qui vise son développement ».
Le ton menaçant de :namespace prefix = st1 ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:smarttags" /la Chine
Tous les observateurs nont pas manqué de souligner la virulence des termes employés par les autorités chinoises pour fustiger le « caractère politique » du Nobel.
Tout le monde est surpris, dautant que Pékin sest toujours gardé de tout excès de langage dans ses rapports avec le reste du monde. Le ton de la protestation est dune brutalité telle que, beaucoup danalystes y ont décelé un début de changement de cap dans la diplomatie de lEmpire du Milieu.:namespace prefix = o ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office" /
Les dirigeants des pays occidentaux ont été les premiers à sémouvoir de lattitude de leurs homologues chinois et semblent avoir bien saisi la portée de leur message.
Révolu le temps où :namespace prefix = st1 ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:smarttags" /la Chine
Son statut de puissance économique conquérante est pour beaucoup dans cette nouvelle voie inaugurée par Pékin qui semble dire à ses partenaires, que ce sont eux qui ont le plus besoin de lui et non le contraire. Sans largent chinois, un pays comme les Etats-Unis aurait sombré encore plus dans la crise. Et la Chine
La nouvelle attitude de Pékin nest au fait que laboutissement dun processus qui a commencé depuis quelques années et que la crise économique frappant essentiellement les puissances industrielles traditionnelles avait accentué.
Sur plusieurs dossiers, la déplomatie chinoise sest montrée en désaccord avec ses principaux partenaires. Ses rapports avec ces derniers sont empreints de suspicion, voire de méfiance. Ceci explique son intransigeance sur la question de lappréciation de sa monnaie, sa position à Copenhague en 2009 sur la réduction des émissions de carbone et son refus catégorique de souscrire à des objectifs contraignants sur
A lONU, Pékin fait de la résistance sur le dossier du nucléaire iranien et se montre ferme sur celui de la Corée
En un mot les dirigeants chinois nadmettent plus quon leur dicte la politique à suivre, chez eux, dans leur région et dans le reste du monde où leurs relations avec plusieurs secteurs économiques vitaux agacent au plus haut degré les anciennes puissances coloniales et tout le monde occidental qui constatent lémergence de ce dragon avec de sérieuses inquiétudes et devant laquelle ils sont impuissants.
La manifestation de mauvaise humeur de Pékin devant loctroi du prix Nobel à lun de ses dissidents sinscrit au fait dans la parfaite logique du changement dans le rapport des forces entre lOccident et lEmpire du Milieu.

description.hltext_display: NYPA helps local firms power up
description.author: David J. Hill
description.content:
TOWN OF TONAWANDA — A critical competitive resource will continue to be delivered to dozens of Western New York manufacturers through the next decade thanks to legislation approved Tuesday by Gov. David Paterson.
Officials from the New York Power Authority joined numerous business leaders for a news conference at Praxair Inc. to announce the seven-year extension of low cost hydropower contracts for more than 100 Western New York companies, including Praxair, the General Motors Tonawanda Engine facility, 3M, DuPont, General Mills and Nestle Purina.
The contracts begin in 2013 and run through 2020. They were reached between the New York Power Authority and Power for Economic Prosperity, a consortium of companies that buy power from NYPA.
“Since electricity is the major cost factor in our energy intensive business, we are vitally interested in maintaining access to low cost hydropower,” said Sean Durbin, a Praxair vice president. “Praxair came to Western New York because of hydropower and remains here because of hydropower.”
Cheap hydropower has been an invaluable resource to GM’s Tonawanda Engine facility on River Road, plant manager Steve Finch said. “That power helps us because we’re kind of away from the core of the Detroit area, so we’ve got to have some advantages,” he said. “This is probably one of the most attractive features of doing business in this area.”
Tonawanda Engine facility manager Gary Londo said hydropower has helped the plant remain competitive within General Motors, which helped the facility earn nearly $900 million in investment for new engine lines this year.
The governor’s approval of the contracts is expected to help protect nearly 30,000 jobs while ensuring capital investments totaling approximately $150 million each year. The contracts, Paterson said in a statement, “will serve as a cornerstone for Western New York manufacturers to manage production costs and operate competitively.”
He added, “This initiative is especially imperative in today’s challenging economic climate, and the hydropower contract extensions are a key element of our efforts in this part of the state.”
State Sen. George Maziarz, R-Newfane, called the long-term contract extensions among the most important pieces of legislation the governor will have signed before leaving office at the end of the month.
“What this really means is that we keep our greatest natural asset — the power that’s generated here at the Niagara (power) plant — here. ...It’s our greatest opportunity for the redevelopment, the economic renaissance of Western New York,” Maziarz said.
The contracts include increased job thresholds that recipients must meet and maintain for the duration of the contract. In addition, the agreements include a new provision for an annual capital investment commitment over the life of the contracts, the governor’s office said.
Previous contracts called for capital improvements only when the initial hydropower allocation was awarded. Companies also must conduct energy efficiency audits and verify that they’ve implemented energy improvements.
“I was particularly interested to see that there are energy conservation measures that are introduced as part of these agreements because we don’t want provisional low cost hydropower to subsidize waste,” Niagara Falls Mayor Paul Dyster said. “If you become more and more efficient at making widgets, you can make even more widgets with the same amount of hydropower.”
Dyster also said hydropower is the strongest economic development asset the region has, and that officials need to leverage it “to the absolute maximum extent.”
While there have been rumors in Albany of merging the New York Power Authority with the Long Island Power Authority, officials said Tuesday there are no plans for such a move. “No one’s looking to take hydropower from Western New York,” said NYPA President and CEO Richard Kessel, a Long Islander. “I guarantee you, we’re not looking to take any hydropower from Western New York. We want to take more of it and use it for economic development up here.”
Officials said keeping low cost hydropower in the region is imperative to its economic success. “These extensions will ensure that the energy created here in Western New York stays in our region and contributes to the strengthening of our economy and the job creation efforts within our communities,” Rep. Chris Lee, R-Clarence, said in a statement.
Kessel said the long-term extensions will help retain jobs and also provide companies a tool for expansion, which in turn will create additional jobs. “I am proud to say that Western New York is on the rebound,” Kessel declared, citing the recent opening of a data center in Lockport for Internet giant Yahoo!.
“This contract extension ... is wonderful news to our region,” Assemblyman Robin Schimminger, D-Kenmore, said, adding that the contracts give local companies a much-needed advantage in a competitive global market. “Today’s contract extensions will provide these industries with the tools corporate management needs to invest, upgrade and perhaps expand their local operations,” he said.

?No one?s looking to take hydropower from Western New York,?
President and CEO, New York Power Authority
citing the recent opening of a data center in Lockport for Internet giant Yahoo
the contracts give local companies a much-needed advantage in a competitive global market.

The contracts, Paterson said in a statement, ?will serve as a cornerstone for Western New York manufacturers to manage production costs and operate competitively.? He added, ?This initiative is especially imperative in today?s challenging economic climate
hydropower has helped the plant remain competitive within General Motors, which helped the facility earn nearly $900 million in investment for new engine lines this year
?Since electricity is the major cost factor in our energy intensive business, we are vitally interested in maintaining access to low cost hydropower,?
the long-term extensions will help retain jobs and also provide companies a tool for expansion, which in turn will create additional jobs

description.hltext_display: Christmas memories of simpler time sweet
description.content:
Remember When By Doris Schroeder
As the years of living have sped by and are now lost in the distance, Christmases past are still present with a bittersweet taste. No, it's not the taste of presents or sweet delicacies. It is the flavor of precious memories with loved ones, special moments, but most of all the closeness to the One born in a manger and his death on the cross.
An integral part of Christmas throughout my entire life has been the children's program. This stems from the time I was a little girl with a simple piece to say, a play to memorize or a song to sing, continuing through the years of directing and then writing church Christmas programs, to the present time of just sitting back and enjoying them. It has lent the reason for the season and helped focus on what Christmas is all about - the birthday of Jesus Christ. In the eyes of a child, you could say it was "the frosting on the cake."
Through all kinds of weather, we always made it through to the church on Christmas Eve, the night of the program. Of course, we never missed the country school program, either. I don't remember it ever being called off because of a blizzard. Most of the memorable years, the stars were twinkling in the sky, just like they did over Bethlehem, as recorded in the Gospel of Luke in the Bible.
The luminaries were even closer during the years on the farm. It could have been because our abode was on a hill and was a little closer to the heavens. Or it could have come from the fact that these were important moments in the simple life we were living and the heavens only echoed our own joy and anticipation of the Christmas event.
On Dec. 12 of this year, we witnessed the children's program at the Medora Community Bible Church. Again, the children of all ages, some dressed as shepherds, Wise Men, angels, Mary, Joseph, and speakers, marched to the stage in the darkened sanctuary. As the spotlights came on, their faces were beaming with the most important message in the world - that Jesus Christ is born!
From the innocent little 3-year-olds to the mature grade school students, the love of God radiated from their faces as they told us the real meaning of what Christmas is all about.
The little shepherd holding a stuffed lamb reminded me of the year we had a real lamb on the stage at Union Valley. I was afraid it would run into the audience, but even the lamb was on his best behavior for the program. He did bleat, however, a little off-cue, but I guess that's what made it a memorable event.
The school program would have been woven with all the nights of practicing I did in the barn, while being there to hold the lantern for my dad. While he milked the cows, I would stand outside, practicing my part for the program, using all the gusto I had in me. The stars would twinkle up above as I poured out my youthful passion to the skies. The lantern I held in my hand was often gestured with the words to some skit I was practicing, of course titled "The Light in the Window"!
When I practiced in the barn, the glazed eyes of the cows, watching disinterestedly, taught me to concentrate on the message more than the rendition. Somehow, practicing in the barn made the Christmas story more realistic in my mind because I actually brought hay to the cows in the barn. The Christmas story was a real part of life, along with the smell that permeates a barn.
As Dad and I walked across the farmyard on a cold December night, with me carrying the lantern, the twinkling stars would remind us of the shepherds tending their flocks by night. The sheep we knew about were from the neighbor's herd that sometimes got out onto our wheat field and had to be chased away immediately since they pulled up the whole tuft of the growing wheat. We could understand the shepherd's job only too well.
Outside in the farmyard, a low moan would occasionally drift from the barn as the farm animals got more comfortable. Occasionally, a little cackle from the henhouse belied the settling in of the chickens. The stars continued their vigil in the cold night air, belying their joy in the somber night sky.
As we finally made it back into the big two-story farmhouse after finishing the chores for the night, the shadows on the wall of the large farm kitchen, made by the burning coal stove, lent credence to the Christmas story of long ago. Warming up by the cozy fire, we could feel the life of the shepherds as they crouched on their hills, keeping watch over their flock by night.
Our lot, however, was cozier, as we enjoyed a cup of hot tea by the fire. That, along with some left-over corn bread from supper, would constitute the remainder of the evening. Since the REA had not yet come through with electricity and the kerosene lamps did not lend enough light for much reading, we would daydream of our life to come, still feeling the magic of the Christmas story found in Luke 2 of the Bible.
Christmas will always have a certain taste for me. It is delicious!
Doris welcomes your comments and can be reached at dorisschroeder@msn.com.

description.hltext_display: Doble de "Hombre Ara�a" cae 9 metros en preestreno obra Broadway
VS gaat belang in AIG verkopen met een enorme winst
description.content:
De Verenigde Staten zijn van plan het belang in de verzekeraar AIG volgend jaar grotendeels te verkopen. Dat zal gebeuren in twee etappes, zo hebben Amerikaanse functionarissen tegenover het persbureau Reuters verklaard. De rest van het belang doet de Amerikaanse staat in 2012 van de hand.
Gered
AIG werd in 2008 door de Amerikaanse overheid gered nadat het tientallen miljarden dollars had verloren op investeringen in de Amerikaanse hypotheekmarkt. De staat heeft nu het leeuwendeel van de verzekeraar in handen. Volgens de zegslieden zal de staat in de eerste helft van 2011 een vijfde van zijn belang op de markt brengen.
Winst
Op basis van de huidige koers, levert de verkoop de overheid flinke winst op. Het belang is nu 90 miljard dollar waard, bijna het dubbele van wat de staat ervoor heeft neergelegd.
© RTLZ.nl

description.hltext_display: Robot waiters in China never lose patience
description.content:
JINAN, China Â Service with a smile also comes with an electronic voice at the Dalu Robot restaurant, where the hotpot meals are not as famous yet as the staff who never lose their patience and never take tips.
The restaurant, which opened this month in Jinan in northern Shandong province, is touted as China's first robot hotpot eatery where robots resembling Star Wars droids circle the room carrying trays of food in a conveyor belt-like system.
More than a dozen robots operate in the restaurant as entertainers, servers, greeters and receptionists. Each robot has a motion sensor that tells it to stop when someone is in its path so customers can reach for dishes they want.
The service industry in China has not always kept up with the country's rapid economic growth, and can be quite basic in some restaurants, leading customers in the Dalu restaurant to praise the robots.
"They have a better service attitude than humans," said Li Xiaomei, 35, who was visiting the restaurant for the first time.
"Humans can be temperamental or impatient, but they don't feel tired, they just keep working and moving round and round the restaurant all night," Li said.
Inspired by space exploration, robot technology and global innovation, the restaurant's owner, Zhang Yongpei, said he hopes his restaurant will show the world China is a serious competitor in developing technology.
"I hope this new concept shows that China is forward-thinking and innovative," Zhang said.
As customers enter the dimly lit restaurant lined with blinking neon lights to simulate a futuristic environment, a female robot decorated with batting eyelashes greets people with an electronic "welcome."
During the meal, crowds of up to 100 customers, are entertained by a dancing and talking robot that looks more like a mannequin with a dress, flapping its arms around in a stiff motion.
Zhang said he hopes to roll out 30 robots - which cost $6,000 each - in the coming months and eventually develop robots with human-like qualities that serve customers at their table and can walk up and down the stairs.

description.hltext_display: Entry-Level Carpet Cleaning Machines Offer Cleaning Contractors Heat and Value
description.author: Daimer Industries, Inc
description.content: --(PR.com)-- Daimer Industries, Inc.®, which is established trans-nationally for its high-performance carpet cleaning machines targeting cleaning contractors, has begun to ship the XPH-5800T line of heated systems. The new equipment offers high pressure cleaning and advanced extraction in a compact unit ideal for use in residential and commercial settings, as well as small spaces."These compact footprint carpet shampooers provide steam pressure levels and vacuum suction previously found only in pricier units," explains Matthew Baratta, a Daimer.com media spokesman. "Moreover, the carpet cleaning machines include our Quick-Dry technology that reduces carpet dry times and gets cleaning pros in and out fast."Carpet Cleaning Machines with Big Performance at a Small PriceThe heated 5800T line of carpet cleaning machines for cleaning contractors features pump pressures rated for up to 100 psi, heating to temperatures of up to 150F, as well as water lift and air flows of 100 inches and 100 cfm, respectively. For periods of uninterrupted cleaning, the carpet cleaning machines are outfitted with solution tanks of 4.5 gallons and waste recovery tanks of 4 gallons.The new equipment includes a tank heating element and the ability to heat to full operation in as little as 15 minutes. Daimer®'s proprietary Quick-Dry technology reduces fluid usage and waste which allows for extended periods of use between refills. The technology also yields carpet drying times of as little as four hours on carpets and typically less on upholstery. Humidity and air temperature can also affect drying times.The small-footprint unit weighs in at 59 pounds and measures about a foot in width and about two feet in depth.For additional information about Daimer®'s unheated carpet cleaning machines, auto detailing carpet cleaning machines, carpet cleaning equipment, carpet shampooer options or upholstery carpet cleaner systems for cleaning contractors, visit www.daimer.com/carpet-cleaner/ or call Matthew Baratta at (888) 507-2220.About Daimer Industries, Inc.®:Daimer®, www.daimer.com, is a major supplier and worldwide exporter of the cleaning industry's leading line of KleenJet® steam cleaners/vapor steam cleaners/steam cleaning equipment; Super Max commercial and industrial pressure washers, including cold water, hot water, and steam pressure washing machines; XTreme Power® floor cleaners, including carpet cleaners, hard surface cleaners, and floor buffers/scrubbers/burnishers; and the line of Micro-Blasting® Eco-Green® environmentally friendly cleaning products that employ unique technologies and a patented, proprietary chemistry.Contact:Matthew Baratta, Daimer Industries, Inc.®16 Tower Office ParkWoburn, MA 01801http://www.daimer.com/carpet-cleaner/matt@daimer.com(888) 507-2220###New tank-heated XTreme Power® XPH-5800T systems offer advanced technologies at modest prices for janitorial professionals.

description.content:
Facendo doppio click su una qualsiasi parola presente nell'articolo, sarà vocalizzata la pronuncia corretta e visualizzata la definizione della parola e i suoi sinonimi e contrari, così come sono stati pubblicati all'interno dei Dizionari Zanichelli.
Per ogni parola verranno citati anche i proverbi che la contengono.
La stessa parola è presente infine nel lemmario Italiano-Inglese del Ragazzini (Dizionario di inglese), per cui ne sarà proposta la traduzione in inglese e dove disponibile in albanese, spagnolo, tedesco e francese.

description.hltext_display: [アビスパ福岡] アビ 磐田・松浦獲得確実に サイドハーフの補強成功 (10:35)
Reciben dos mujeres indulto presidencial
description.author: NTX
description.content:
SAN JOSÉ (NTX)._ Dos mujeres, quienes se hallaban en prisión, recibieron ayer indulto presidencial en Costa Rica por razones humanitarias, informó ayer el Ministro de Justicia, Hernando París.
En el primer caso, se trata de Sally Priscilla Calderón, sentenciada a ocho años de prisión bajo el cargo de haber introducido drogas a un centro penitenciario donde su ex compañero está recluido, en la oriental provincia caribeña costarricense de Limón, dijo París.
En el segundo, la indultada es la indígena Olivia Bejarano, condenada a 13 años de prisión acusada de haber participado en un homicidio en su comunidad en el sector de Talamanca, en el extremo sur de la misma provincia, indicó el Ministro.
Los dos indultos, parte de 45 presentados a la Presidenta costarricense Laura Chinchilla, se enmarcan en la celebración de la Navidad, indicó el jerarca gubernamental.

description.hltext_display: Fire Breaks Out At BSN Ampangan Branch, Three Contract Workers Rescued
description.content: SEREMBAN, Dec 22 (Bernama) -- Fire broke out at the Ampangan branch of the Bank Simpanan Nasional (BSN), here this morning resulting in losses amounting to hundreds of thousand ringgit. The fire, which started at about 6am, destroyed equipment and office space on the ground and first floors of the three-storey building. However, no money belonging to the bank was reported lost in the fire. Chief of operations, Zakaria Amat said he received a distress call at about 6.20am and upon arrival, the ground floor was already on fire. "At that time, three men were trapped on the first floor and we had to use a ladder to rescue them. "The three men, in their 30's, were believed to be contract workers who were renovating the bank. However, none of them sustained any injury," he said. Zakaria said his men managed to bring the fire under control within about 15 minutes and the fire was completely put out at 7.30am. The fire had caused severe damage to the ground floor. A bank official, who declined to be identified, the bank was in the process of being renovated. Total losses and the cause of the fire were being investigated. -- BERNAMA

description.hltext_display: Lebanon-based Cracker Barrel takes Southern fare to Northern borders
description.content:
SOUTH PORTLAND, Maine Southern-fried restaurant chain Cracker Barrel is finding hungry customers in the land of lobster, steamers and baked beans. Cracker Barrel General Store's first restaurant in Maine represents the chain's northernmost foray along the East Coast. And Mainers seem to be taking a shine to the chicken and dumplings, biscuits and sawmill gravy, and other Southern staples such as turnip greens, pork barbecue and grits.
Well, scratch the grits.
"I'll try anything once, but I'm not trying those grits. No way," Sandra Butler of South Portland said with a chuckle, after giving fried okra and turnip greens a try.
Southern cooking knows no boundaries, apparently. The South Portland restaurant was running 25 percent ahead of projections when it opened last month, according to the company.
Decorated with antiques, rocking chairs and checkerboards, the restaurant presents a familiar face to New Englanders who've traveled through Florida and other parts of the South where Cracker Barrels are a highway fixture. And they've developed a loyal following, even far north of the Mason-Dixon line.
Chris and Anne Taylor of Topsham readily confess that they used to drive two hours to eat at a Cracker Barrel in Massachusetts before the South Portland restaurant opened. Now the restaurant is only 30 miles away, and they've made it a Wednesday night ritual to dine there for "date night."
"The nice thing about a place like this is you get to experience a little taste of another part of the country cuisine that you don't get if you grow up in Maine," he said.
Different fare
New England isn't exactly known for daring cuisine.
Staples include baked cod and haddock, pulled from the North Atlantic. In the summer, there are steamed mussels and clams. And of course, New England is known for chowder, lobster and baked bean suppers.
Cracker Barrel's menu is different. It features things such as country-fried steak, fried chicken, fried chicken livers and catfish; fried apples, pinto beans, turnip greens and hashbrown casserole; for dessert there's a plethora of cobblers. (2 of 2)The Tennessee-based restaurant chain got its start in 1969 when Danny Evans opened a restaurant with an eye to recreating the country store of yesteryear, when crackers were delivered in barrels and barrels were recycled as checkerboard tables. The South Portland restaurant can seat 207, but the company markets the modern Cracker Barrel as a place where customers can find time to slow down.
Until the early 1990s, the company stuck mostly to its base in the South, but now it has 597 restaurants in 42 states.
The South Portland restaurant opens as customers around the country have shown greater willingness over the past six to eight months to dine out after a disastrous couple of years in which restaurants were hard-hit by bankruptcies, said R.J. Hottovy, senior analyst at Chicago-based Morningstar, an investment research firm.
"There's a willingness to spend more, or to allocate more dollars to dining out," he said. "Generally speaking, we have seen traffic improve in the casual dining space."
With $2.4 billion in revenue for its last fiscal year, the company is looking for additional opportunities to expand and hasn't ruled out more locations in Maine.
That'd be just fine with Elizabeth Grant of Westbrook. The homey feel and comfort food take her back to a simpler time.
"What draws us to it is that it's just like home cooking. Even though it's a big restaurant, a big chain of restaurants, they still capture that," she said. "It's nice."

description.hltext_display: Quand la lune vire totalement au rouge !
description.content:
Le Temps-Agences - A l'heure dite hier, comme par magie mais très exactement comme annoncé par les astronomes, :namespace prefix = st1 ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:smarttags" /la Lune
L'éclipse totale a débuté à 08H41 HT: la pleine Lune, la Terre
Entièrement dans le cône d'ombre de la Terre
:namespace prefix = o ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office" /
L'éclipse totale de Lune était observable en Amérique du Nord, en Europe de l'Ouest et dans une partie de l'Asie pendant plus d'une heure (de 06H41 à 09H53 HT), à condition que des nuages n'aient pas masqué le phénomène.
Sur un parking de Reykjavik, l'Association des astronomes amateurs a installé un télescope pour permettre à une trentaine de courageux Islandais de pouvoir profiter du ciel parfaitement clair et observer mieux encore les astres et la Lune.
"C'est absolument magnifique", s'extasie Torfi Olafur Sverrisson, quadragénaire employé de la banque Islandsbanki qui voit pour la première fois une éclipse de Lune.
La Nasa
En Suède, le public rassemblé à Vuollerim sur le cercle polaire n'a pas eu cette chance, une épaisse couche nuageuse ayant contrarié ses espoirs.
"C'est décevant mais c'est comme ça, vous ne pouvez pas contrôler la météo", commente avec un certain recul une touriste américaine de 60 ans, Wanda Daehlin, venue de Spokane (Etat de Washington).
Le 4 janvier, c'est la Lune

description.hltext_display: From My Home to Yours
description.content:
Ottawa City Editor Jennifer Hughes has an ongoing love affair with design, art, fashion and food that began many years ago with redecorating her dollhouse or staging impromptu Barbie fashion shows. Now she unearths the best of the above in our vibrant capital city.
capital city scene: holiday anticipation canada (Dec.22.10)
In the blur that is December, I don’t often take the time to enjoy the anticipation of the holidays like I did when I was a kid.
At this point, most of the shopping is done, the tree is up and decorated (we carried ours home from the field at Ian’s Evergreen Plantation), the cookies are baked (and, um, nothing is wrapped). But in the interest of stopping and letting the sentimental kid in me work up a little holiday joy, here are five things I’m looking forward to:
1. A white Christmas. Since moving to Ottawa five years ago, I haven’t seen a green Christmas. I’m not one of those people who could happily spend the holidays down south drinking fruity cocktails on the beach. Really. I want the classic Canadian experience, and snow is a requirement for that.
2. Eating Santa’s cookies. This is one of the benefits to actually being the one stuffing stockings. No sooner are the kids tucked into bed than my husband and I are downstairs noshing on the carefully laid-out treats, having a giggle. This year, I think Santa might like a spiked eggnog.
3. Watching others open their gifts. This is the best part of Christmas Day (well, that and turkey). I don’t claim to always find the perfect gift for the hard-to-buy-for person (ahem, big bro), but I sure try.
4. No shopping for a week. I’m a dedicated shopaholic, but even I like to take a break every now and then. Once the stores close on Christmas Eve, I’m happy to step away from the cash register for a solid week. I’m not interested in fighting the crowds on Boxing Day. I’d rather be home curled up with a new book, giving the credit card a much-needed rest.
5. That magic moment. It’s usually late on Christmas Eve, when all the gifts are wrapped and under the tree, the stockings are filled, and everything’s ready. There’s a hush in the air, the quiet before the chaos of the next day unfolds. I love this moment. It’s when I realize how lucky I am and how little all those presents really matter. It’s the people that will be opening them that are the real gifts.
Happy Holidays.

description.hltext_display: Ako budú tráviť Vianoce naši politici?
description.content:
Zdroj: JANA PUSTAYOVÁ, JÁN ZEMIAR Dušan Galis sa na sviatky chystá domov na Oravu.
Tradičná kapustnica, kapor, stromček, rodina pokope a darčeky. To sú Vianoce, ako ich poznáme. Strávia ich rovnako aj naši politici? Spýtali sme sa ich, či budú na Vianoce doma v kruhu najbližších alebo si doprajú netradičnú atmosféru sviatkov.
Dušan Galis
poslanec za Smer
Poslanec bude Vianoce tráviť tradične doma na Orave s rodinou. „Keď sa povedia Vianoce, teším sa na sneh a najmä na oravské Vianoce u nás doma. Vždy tam bolo veľa snehu a veľa kamarátov.“ Najkrajším darčekom by pre poslanca bolo, keby boli všetci v jeho okolí zdraví a šťastní. Ivan Mikloš minister financií, SDKÚ Vianoce bude tráviť na chalupe v Tatrách. Zostane tam aj medzi sviatkami a na Silvestra. Vianoce najradšej oslavuje na Slovensku a so svojou najbližšou rodinou.
Richard Sulík
predseda parlamentu, SAS
„Sviatočné chvíle budem tráviť s rodinou a ešte s tým pokladom, ktorý so mnou žije doma,“ prezradil šéf parlamentu. U Sulíkovcov nesmie chýbať kapustnica so sušenými dubákmi a ryba. Na sviatky sa nechystá nikam, teší sa na oddych v kruhu najbližších.
Tomáš Galbavý
poslanec za SDKÚ
„Jednoznačne budem na sviatky doma. Najviac sa teším na vianočnú úprimnú domácu rodinnú pohodu. Teším sa, že k nám pricestuje dcéra s manželom a vnučkou a budeme spolu tráviť Vianoce u nás v Nitre.“ Poslanec sa najviac teší na spoločné zdobenie stromčeka a balenie darčekov. „Máme dve polievky, jednu hríbovú a druhú rybaciu, vyprážame tradičného kapra,“ dodal Tomáš Galbavý.
Daniel Lipšic
minister vnútra, KDH
Sviatky bude tráviť doma, kvôli malému synovi nechce ísť nikam na hory. „Skombinovali sme zvyky manželkinej a mojej rodiny. Najskôr je klasická modlitba, čítanie z Písma. Potom štedrá večera – oblátky s medom a cesnakom, jablko s orechmi, kyslá hríbová polievka. Ďalej nasleduje ryba, vyprážaný kapor s majonézovým šalátom a na záver sú makové pupáky,“ opísal nám Lipšic.
Béla Bugár
podpredseda parlamentu, Most-Híd
Vianočné sviatky bude tráviť tradične doma s najbližšími. „Na Vianoce budem doma s rodinou. Naše Vianoce budú presne také, aké majú byť, ako všetci poznáme, so všetkou tou vianočnou klasikou, rybou a darčekmi.“
Igor Matovič
poslanec za SaS
Vianoce bude oslavovať doma s najbližšou rodinou. „Budeme mať Vianoce úplne normálne so všetkým, čo k tomu patrí. Stromček, darčeky a ťuťuli-muťuli. Tento rok nás čaká netradičná vianočná výzdoba. Inšpirovali sme sa stromčekom, ktorý sme videli na výlete vo Viedni, takže naše babizne (dcéry) ho ozdobia svojimi hračkami.“
Renáta Zmajkovičová
poslankyňa za Smer
Poslankyňa sa teší na Vianoce, ktoré strávi v kruhu rodiny. „U mňa je to vždy spojené jednak s romantikou chvíle, ale aj s nostalgickými spomienkami na Vianoce detstva. Najdôležitejšie je, že rodina je spolu. Veľmi rada pečiem, vždy tomu venujem víkend pred Vianocami, takže u nás to už teraz vonia medovníkmi a inými dobrotami.“
Mária Sabolová
poslankyňa za KDH
„Vianoce strávim doma s mamičkou,“ povedala nám poslankyňa Sabolová a dodala, že Vianoce sú pre ňu vždy najdôležitejším sviatkom rodiny. Poslankyňa nám prezradila, že je veriaca a vianočné sviatky si veľmi váži. „Tieto sviatky vnímam ako jedno z najdôležitejších období v živote veriacich, je to začiatok cirkevného roku. U nás sme vždy Vianoce slávili ako najkrajší sviatok roka, ktorý utužoval rodinu.“
Eugen Jurzyca
minister školstva, SDKÚ
Štedrý večer trávi doma s rodinkou, ale hneď deň nato cestuje na Moravu k manželkinej rodine a užíva si vianočnú atmosféru, stromček a darčeky druhýkrát.
Lucia Žitňanská
ministerka spravodlivosti, SDKÚ
Vianoce oslavuje tradične doma. „Sme konzervatívni a dodržiavame tradície. Vianoce s nami oslavuje u nás doma aj moja mama. Vždy sme celá rodina spolu, aby nikto nebol sám.“
Magda Vášáryová
poslankyňa za SDKÚ
Vianoce bude tráviť ako obvykle doma s rodinou. „Môj muž hrá aj tesne pred, aj po Vianociach, ako vždy. Títo ľudia nemajú voľno, takže my budeme celá rodina tak ako vždy na chalupe pri Bratislave,“ povedala nám poslankyňa.
Ján Počiatek
poslanec za Smer
Vianoce slávi tradične, v rodinnom kruhu. Má rád vianočnú atmosféru, ale kapra nejedáva. „Namiesto kapra kupujeme inú rybu. Nejaké filé, len aby som splnil formálnu časť, že som si dal aj rybu, ale kapor mi nechutí.“
Sergej Kozlík
poslanec Európskeho parlamentu
Na Vianoce bude doma s rodinou, na druhý deň pôjdu na Tále. „Som odchovaný na kapustnici. Až potom manželstvo donieslo aj kapra. My máme také typické stredniacke Vianoce, čiže hustá kapustnica a ešte sa z nej vylovila klobáska,“ prezradil nám poslanec.
Jarmila Tkáčová
poslankyňa za SDKÚ
Poslankyňa sa tiež zaradila medzi tradičných vyznávačov domácej vianočnej atmosféry. „S domovom sú spojené len pekné asociácie. Deti, rodina, darčeky, pokoj. Vianoce majú svoje čaro aj v tom, že sa čosi raz za rok vracia v takej podobe, akú to malo celý život,“ povedala nám poslankyňa Tkáčová a priznala, že žiadne väčšie prekvapenie pre svojich blízkych nechystá.
Ivan Mikloš
minister financií, SDKÚ
Vianoce bude tráviť na chalupe v Tatrách. Zostane tam aj medzi sviatkamia na Silvestra. Vianoce najradšej oslavuje na Slovensku a so svojou najbližšou rodinou.

description.hltext_display: Teror Laser Malaysia Ancam Performa Timnas
description.content:
Rabu, 22 Desember 2010 15:08 WIB 0 Komentar 0 0
Penulis : Daniel Wesly Rudolf
JAKARTA--MICOM: Ancaman teror dari suporter Malaysia dengan menggunakan laser pada laga final leg pertama Piala AFF Suzuki Cup 2010 yang mempertemukan Indonesia melawan Malaysia, ditanggapi serius oleh timnas Indonesia.
Pelatih timnas Alfred Riedl mengatakan, teror laser dari suporter Negeri Jiran merupakan tindakan negatif.
Diberitakan surat kabar Tin The Thao, muncul sorotan laser berwarna hijau dari fans Malaysia kepada penjaga gawang tim tamu, Bui Tan Truong, khususnya sepanjang babak kedua.
Media massa Vietnam mensinyalir gol pertama "Negeri Jiran" yang disarangkan Mohd Safee akibat pandangan kiper yang terganggu sinar laser.
"Saya memang tidak mengetahui tentang kebenaran teror laser itu. Bila pun benar, itu merupakan tindakan buruk. Saya tetap berharap itu tidak terjadi dan bahkan memengaruhi performa tim," kata Riedl seusai latihan timnas di lapangan C, Senayan, Jakarta, Rabu (22/12).
Sejumlah pemain timnas juga memberi penilaian yang sama dengan pelatih asal Austria itu. Menurut kiper andalan Indonesia, Markus, teror laser dari suporter Malaysia tentu akan berpengaruh terhadap timnas.
"Saya berusaha tetap fokus pada pertandingan laga final leg pertama nanti. Semoga tidak berpengaruh terhadap teror sinar laser dari suporter Malaysia," kata Markus.
Striker muda tim Merah Putih, Yongki Ariwibowo juga menegaskan bahwa para pemain sama sekali tidak gentar dengan dukungan besar dari suporter Malaysia kepada tim kesayangannya. Bukan tidak mungkin Yongki dkk, juga akan menjadi bulan-bulanan cemooh dari pendukung Malaysia.
â€œYang penting tetap fokus dan membawa pulang kemenangan buat modal di leg kedua. Kita usahakan yang terbaik untuk negara,â€ kata Yongki. (OL-9)

description.hltext_display: Uncorked: Sips to suit most any Christmas feast
description.content:
Thanksgiving is turkey day, but for Christmas, we all have our own traditions — everything from boiled fish to lechon asado to roast beef with Yorkshire pudding. So we each get to choose our wines. Here are some candidates:
For a Hispanic Nochebuena dinner of roast suckling pig with garlic, oregano and sour oranges, a hearty, red California syrah.
For Haiti's popular boiled fish dinner — with fish simmered in lemon juice, garlic, onions, celery leaves and tomato sauce — a crisp and savory sauvignon blanc.
For traditional English roast beef with Yorkshire pudding, a cholesterol-cutting red California cabernet sauvignon.
For the Italian Christmas Eve seafood extravaganza called The Feast of the Seven Fishes, an Italian pinot grigio.
For a German Christmas dinner of roast goose, a big, powerful Italian amarone.
For a holiday dinner of juicy spiral-cut ham, rose. (Pink food, pink wine. It figures.)
In my house, we have rich, buttery lobster on Christmas Eve, with a rich, buttery chardonnay-based champagne.
For a turkey dinner, if you didn't get enough at Thanksgiving, a warm and mellow merlot.
If you're going vegan with a savory wild mushroom risotto, a rich, kosher chardonnay. I say kosher because some nonkosher wines are "fined," or clarified, by dropping beaten egg whites through them. Kosher wines are fined with clay.
Christmas Day often means brunch. For egg casseroles, a mimosa — bubbly spiked with orange juice or, in these antioxidant-intensive days, maybe pomegranate juice. For French toast or coffee cake, a sweet riesling ice wine. For poached salmon, pinot noir.
Finally, fruitcake. What wine goes with this glorious but disrespected delicacy? Brachetto d'Acqui, the sweet, red bubbly from Italy. That's both of my favorite guilty pleasures in a single package.
Highly recommended
2007 Kendall-Jackson "Grand Reserve" Merlot, Napa/Sonoma: black cherry and black pepper aromas and flavors, soft tannins; $25.
2006 Rubicon Estate Cask Cabernet Sauvignon, Rutherford: black plum and bittersweet chocolate flavors, rich, soft tannins, smooth and long; $75.
2007 Wilson Winery "Dorothy's Vineyard" Syrah, Dry Creek Valley: big and hearty, with black plum and espresso flavors, big, ripe tannins; $30.
Recommended
2009 Banfi Le Rime Pinot Grigio, Italy: light and crisp, with lemon-lime flavors; $9.
2006 Masi Costasera Amarone della Valpolicella Classico, Italy: big and powerful, with flavors of fruitcake and sweet cherries and a hint of sweetness; $49.
2010 Backsberg Estate Kosher Chardonnay, Simonsberg, South Africa: rich, crisp, lemony, with ripe apricot flavors; $14.
2008 Torbreck "Woodcutter's" Shiraz, Barossa Valley, Australia: soft and sweet, with black cherry and strawberry flavors; $22.
2008 Hahn Estates Pinot Noir, Monterey: black cherry and sweet chocolate flavors, rich and soft; $12.
2009 Murphy Goode "The FumC(c)" Sauvignon Blanc, North Coast: herbal and savory, with ripe apricot flavors; $12.
2009 Pascal Jolivet "Attitude" RosC(c) (Pinot Noir), Loire Valley, France (pinot noir, gamay, cabernet sauvignon): light and lively, crisp and fruity, with tart cherry flavors, tart finish; $16.
2007 Pacific Rim Vin de Glaciere dessert wine, Columbia Valley, Wash.: extra-sweet golden apple and pear flavors, crisp balancing acid; $18 per half-bottle.
2009 Banfi Rosa Regale Brachetto d'Acqui, Piedmont, Italy: sweet red raspberry and strawberry flavors, lots of big bubbles; $20.

description.hltext_display: Les preneurs dotages
description.content:
:namespace prefix = o ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office" /
Par Bourguiba Ben Rejeb - On peut penser tout le mal des preneurs dotages, ce commerce se porte à merveille. Les bandits de haute mer gagnent plutôt bien leur croûte et les armées les plus puissantes narrivent pas à réduire la casse ni à ramener les tarifs à des niveaux de solvabilité acceptables. Même quand on ne le dit pas, ces Etats payent le plus souvent, probablement sous la pression des opinions publiques soucieuses de la vie de ressortissants mis en danger. Ceci étant, il arrive que des preneurs dotages soient épinglés. Dans ce cas, la facilité juridique a été de les traduire devant des tribunaux kényans, allez comprendre pourquoi.
:namespace prefix = o ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office" /
Maintenant, il va falloir ramener à la raison dautres preneurs dotages. En côte dIvoire, le nommé Gbagbo prend tout le pays en otage. Les Nations Unies et les nations désunies lui disent bien haut et fort quil prend des risques à vouloir garder le palais du Calife quand les temps sont au langage des urnes, il nen démord pas. Ceux qui ne sont pas daccord sur ses manières à lui de jouer au pirate sont massacrés quand ils sont Ivoiriens. Ils sont boutés hors des frontières quand ils sont étrangers.
Les pirates de tous genres ont ceci de particulier quils prennent tout le monde de court. Le fait accompli remplace tous les arguments de moralité et de légalité. Il suffit par la suite de réussir lhabillage par les discours qui enflamment les foules et canalisent les rancurs.
Il fut un temps où la piraterie et la prise dotages tenaient de la politique des empires. Il ny a pas si longtemps aussi, les colonisations tenaient de lacte moral de la civilisation usurpatrice des biens et des doits. Maintenant, on est supposé tout oublier et recommencer. Gbagbo fait le désespoir des démocrates, mais demain, il ne doit pas être mis tout seul sur le banc de linfamie.
B.B.R.

description.hltext_display: Zo vrij is het woord niet
Deja motín en cárcel de Chile 40 heridos
description.author: NTX/AP
description.content:
El 8 de diciembre se registró una riña en el interior de la cárcel de San Miguel, en Chile la cual dejó 81 muertos
Fotografía: AP.
CHILE (NTX/AP)._Un nuevo motín se registró ayer en una cárcel del norte de Chile en protesta por el hacinamiento que reina en los penales del País. Al menos 40 personas resultaron heridas durante en el penal ubicado en la ciudad chilena de Antofagasta. El incidente se registró a casi dos semanas del incendio que afectó a un penal capitalino, que dejó 81 muertos.
La protesta protagonizada por los internos de la cárcel de Antofagasta, mil 370 kilómetros al norte de Santiago, dejó un saldo de 34 reos y seis gendarmes con heridas leves.
La policía antimotines ingresó al penal y frenó la revuelta, mientras los bomberos controlaron tres focos de incendio en los patios de la cárcel, informó el comandante de bomberos Daniel Bugueño.
El aire también estaba cargado de gases lacrimógenos lanzados por la policía para dispersar a los familiares de los internos que llegaron al recinto.
Las autoridades explicaron que cuatro de los reclusos heridos fueron trasladados, bajo estricta vigilancia, al Hospital Regional, mientras los efectivos de Gendarmería fueron llevados al Hospital Militar de la localidad norteña.
Los desórdenes comenzaron ayer por la mañana, cuando un grupo de reclusos subió al techo del recinto penitenciario manifestándose con lienzos y realizando disparos al aire.
Al lugar llegó personal de Bomberos, quienes ayudaron a controlar un incendio provocado por los internos cerca del mediodía.
El presidente de la Asociación Nacional de Oficiales Penitenciarios, José Maldonado, dijo a periodistas que la situación en el penal se encuentra controlada, aunque todavía quedan algunos focos al interior del recinto.
"La unidad de servicio especial penitenciaria que está reforzando el perímetro indicó que la situación estaría controlada en este minuto, que quedan algunos focos dentro del recinto, pero ya no estaría en riesgo la seguridad pública en Antofagasta" , señaló.
EN HUELGA
Los reclusos de la prisión de Antofagasta, al igual que en Santiago y otras dos ciudades, están en huelga de hambre desde hace poco más de una semana en demanda de un alivio a la superpoblación penal que en Chile bordea el 70 por ciento.
"La unidad de servicio especial penitenciaria que está reforzando el perímetro indicó que la situación estaría controlada en este minuto, que quedan algunos focos dentro del recinto, pero ya no estaría en riesgo la seguridad pública...
Presidente de la Asociación Nacional de Penitenciarios

description.hltext_display: Editorial: A world of difference
description.content:
Time magazine seems to be the only entity in the world that doesn't view its Person, Place or Thing of the Year award as an honor. It wants the freedom to also reward abject villainy for "making a difference" in the world.
OMG, whatever!
Well, whether it be an honor or just a spotlight on impact-making, Time's choice of Facebook founder Mark Zuckerberg as Person of the Year for 2010 is inspired and absolutely spot on.
Time admits to having considered Wikileaks founder and accused sex offender Julian Assange (see villainy, above) and the Tea Party as well -- surprising, since the conservative movement to save the country financially hasn't exactly been the darling of the liberal media, of which Time is a card-carrying member.
But while the Tea Party, the largest and most effective grassroots movement in America since the Civil Rights era, is deserving for having changed this country this year, Zuckerberg and his Facebook phenomenon have changed the world -- forever.
It's not even close.
It's a little scary, since no one, not even Zuckerberg, can say what the longterm effect of Facebook will be on humanity. But for now, it seems to have made it better -- and to have accelerated the speed with which we barrel recklessly into the 21st century.
If you don't use Facebook, you may not know what you're missing. If you use Facebook, you're in big company: Some 550 million humans have a Facebook account -- equivalent to the third-largest country in the world. That amounts to one out of every 12 people on the orb -- astonishing, considering how many people exist miles away from the nearest computer.
Slightly more people eat bread than use Facebook. It's creeping up on water-users as well.
It's amazing, and wholly unprecedented in human history -- and all the more wondrous when you consider that Zuckerberg and most of his cohorts are under 30. Perhaps LeBron James, who left high school to be a professional basketball superstar, should have been sufficient to warn us about the Attack of the 20-Somethings.
Zuckerberg is the mastermind.
The reason is, his baby is a monster prodigy: With Facebook, you can get on your computer and go straight to a virtual room to trade views or mere salutations with only people you've invited into the room. They get out of line, you hide them -- like leaving a horrid conversation at a cocktail party, except they don't even know you're leaving.
Best of all, you keep in constant contact -- as much or as little as you want -- with people you care about. You may never think enough of Bob to actually pick up a phone or write an e-mail to him -- and you may not know his number or address, for that matter. But on Facebook, all you need to know is his name or face, and he yours -- and you can have a five-second conversation every few years.
Moreover, by a never-ending succession of introductions to friends of friends, Facebook puts the network in networking.
And that high school sweetheart? Facebook acts like a free private eye to find them. You can get in touch or keep in touch with as many old or new friends as you like.
In short, it's changing the nature of friendships and empowering individuals like few things before.
And, in the end, it's those individuals who will determine whether it's for good or ill, as Time likes to say.
Mark Zuckerberg has merely started the global conversation.

event_or_fact.property: us about the Attack of the 20-Somethings

description.hltext_display: Франция и Германия казаха „не“ на влизането ни в Шенген
description.content:
Представители на двете страни са информирали ЕК, че са против пускането на България и Румъния в пространството
Статия Коментари (6)
Вчера Франция и Германия са информирали Европейската комисия (ЕК) за решението си да блокират влизането на България и Румъния в Шенгенското пространство, съобщава Dnes.bg.
Еврокомисарят за вътрешните работи Сесилия Малмстрьом е получила писмо от френския и германския вътрешен министър, Брис Ортфьо и Томас де Мезиер, в което се казва, че разрешението за влизане на България и Румъния в Шенген през март 2011 година е „преждевременно”, заяви говорителят на еврокомисаря Микеле Черконе.
В писмото двамата министри обръщат внимание на недостатъците на двете страни в борбата с корупцията и организираната престъпност.
ЕК няма никакво правомощие да взема решения в тази област, посочи говорителят на еврокомисар Малмстрьом.
"Експерти на страните членки посетиха Румъния и България и през януари ще представят доклад, който ще помогне за вземане на решение за приемането на двете страни в Шенгенското пространство", подчерта още Черконе.
Позицията на Германия и Франция показва, че по въпроса няма да бъде постигнато единодушие, което от своя страна ще отложи влизането на София и Букурещ в свободното пространство, допълва АФП.
Позицията на България
"България ще бъде готова технически да влезе в Шенгенското пространство през 2011 г.", обяви говорителят на МВнР Весела Чернева в коментар на новината, че Франция и Германия официално искат отлагане на присъединяването на България към Шенгенското пространство през март догодина.
В писмо до еврокомисаря за вътрешните работи Сесилия Малмстрьом френският и германският министър на вътрешните работи заявиха, че това присъединяване би било "преждевременно", ако се случи през март 2011 г.
"Този дебат е придобил политически характер", поясни още Весела Чернева.
"Нашата задача оттук нататък е още повече да мобилизираме обществото, включително и съдебната система, за да може следващият доклад на ЕК да бъде по-добър от предишния", добави говорителят на Външно.
Нееднократно премиерът Бойко Борисов и вътрешният министър Цветан Цветанов посочваха, че членството ни в Шенген е приоритет №1 на кабинета.
Позицията на Румъния
Румънският президент Траян Бъсеску обяви в декларация, че писмото на двамата вътрешни министри на Германия и Франция до еврокомисарката по сигурността Сесилия Малмстрьом е дискриминационно спрямо Румъния, предаде агенция Медиафакс.
"Писмото съдържа факти от нашата действителност, които не може да бъдат оспорени. Става въпрос за функционирането на съдебната система и институциите на страната.
Имаме проблеми и с работата на Върховния административен съд. Всички доклади, които визират техническата подготовка на Румъния, показват, че страната е изпълнила техническите условия за присъединяването си към Шенгенското пространство.
Смятам, че писмото на двамата министри е дискриминационно спрямо Румъния.
Въвеждането на нови условности противоречи на европейското право и създава неприемлив прецедент.
Румъния има договор за присъединяването си към ЕС, в който точно са описани и условията за присъединяване към Шенген", завърши Бъсеску.

description.hltext_display: Christmas break means hustle-bustle in household
description.content:
THE AMISH COOK By Lovina Eicher
My husband, Joe, is on a two-week Christmas break from work. And the children's school has also closed its doors for two weeks for the holiday season. So, needless to say, our house will not have too much peace and quiet for a while. I guess that is what makes life interesting, though.
The temperature has not gone much over 20 degrees this past week. Even though we have not had too much more snow, the children are still enjoying sledding, with our pony Stormy doing the pulling.
We still have a big pile of dirt in the barnyard from when we built the house. Every morning, Stormy is standing on top of that hill. From where he stands, he can see straight into our kitchen through the window. It almost looks like he waits for the gaslights to be turned on in the morning. I think Stormy enjoys the extra attention over sledding season.
Yesterday was our annual Christmas potluck after church services. Church was held in a home about four miles from here. The roads were still snow-covered and icy, so it makes it an extra effort for the horses to pull the buggies through the snow. We took our "old faithful," our slow but sure horse named Diamond. He is 16 1/2 years old, but he is a good, safe family horse.
Once again, we had a lot more food at the potluck than needed. From casseroles to salads to desserts and fruits, there was a good variety. I took a big roaster of "pizza casserole," for which I will share the recipe at the end of the column.
My sister Emma, her husband, Jacob, and their family spent the afternoon here. We played the board game Aggravation while the children bundled up and went sledding. We popped popcorn for a snack before they left for home. Meanwhile, Elizabeth and her friend Timothy joined his family at his brother's house for supper.
I made eggs, fried potatoes and fried pork for our supper. We have been getting a lot of eggs that the new chickens are all laying. I would like to make homemade noodles while we have the extra supply of eggs. With the coal stove going in the basement, I could dry the noodles down there. I know with the whole family being home for the next two weeks we will use more eggs than usual.
The children's Christmas program was Thursday evening at the school. The children did a wonderful job. Five-year-old Kevin stood up there and watched the audience and forgot all about helping to sing. I think his day had been too long and he was too tired to sing.
The calendar shows that winter officially begins today. Then Wednesday, Dec. 22, is my husband Joe's 42nd birthday. We are planning to take the day off and do some Christmas shopping. Let us always remember the true meaning of Christmas - Jesus our Savior. It is so hard to believe 2010 is almost over.
Joe is planning to do the drywall mudding in the one upstairs bedroom. We emptied out the room so he could work on the walls. He hopes to get enough time over the next two weeks to get that room ready for painting, but there are always so many odd jobs that come up that he sometimes can't finish a project.
Here is the pizza casserole I used for the potluck.
Pizza Casserole
2 pounds sausage
1 box 16-oz. rigatoni pasta, cooked
1 pint pizza sauce
1 10.75-ounce can cream of mushroom soup
1 12-oz.can mushrooms
1 package pepperoni slices
1 medium onion, diced
1 16-ounce package of mozzarella cheese
Brown sausage and onions in a skillet over medium heat. In a casserole dish, layer pasta, pizza sauce, cream of mushroom soup and mushrooms. Top with cheese and pepperoni slices. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes or until thoroughly heated.
Lovina Eicher is Old Order Amish. She handwrites her weekly column by lantern light from her Michigan home. Readers with culinary or cultural questions can write to: The Amish Cook, P.O. Box 2144, Middletown, OH 45042.
